newsitem.title: USA: U.S. man killed by friend in shooting range accident. [CORRECTED 19:51 GMT]
newsitem.headline: U.S. man killed by friend in shooting range accident. [CORRECTED 19:51 GMT]

text.p: A church outing to a shooting range ended in disaster when a young woman accidentally shot and killed a friend, police said on Tuesday.

Michael Chumney, 24, of Redmond, Wash., was pronounced dead late Monday (corrects date) shortly after he was shot by the 30-year-old woman, who apparently could not control the recoil on a .44-calibre revolver, Bellevue Police Lt. Bill Ferguson said.
Ferguson said Chumney and the woman, whose name was not immediately released, were part of a Mormon church group out for an evening of target practice at Wade's Eastside Gun Shop in suburban Seattle.
According to the witnesses, Chumney left his cubicle to let the woman try the Smith & Wesson revolver he was using. He then stood closely behind her to watch.
As she fired, the gun climbed from the recoil, and her third shot was fired back over her shoulder, striking Chumney in the neck, Ferguson said.
He said police were investigating, but "based on the information we've received from witnesses, we believe this is an accidental shooting."
